paper_abstract: Let d = 1 <= d(1) <= d(2) <= center dot center dot center dot <= d(n) be a non-decreasing sequence of n positive integers, whose sum is even. Let G(n,d) denote the set of graphs with vertex set [n] = {1,2,center dot center dot center dot,n} in which the degree of vertex i is d(i). Let G(n,d) be chosen uniformly at random from G(n,d). Let d = (d(1) + d(2)+ center dot center dot center dot + d(n))In be the average degree. We give a condition on d under which we can show that w.h.p. the chromatic number Of G(n,d) is circle dot(d/Ind). This condition is satisfied by graphs with exponential tails as well those with power law tails.
paper_title: On the chromatic number of random graphs with a fixed degree sequence
